The date of the claim: The expert's verdict mentions that the claim states Donald Trump suspended his presidential campaign in December 2015. This aspect is verified by stating that on 22 December 2015, the website Q Political published an article reporting Trump's withdrawal from the race.
Contradictory statements: The expert's verdict highlights that Donald Trump had been dominating the polls and showed no sign of slowing down in the presidential race. This aspect is used to counter the claim that he withdrew from the race, indicating a contradiction in the information provided.
Trump: s own statement: The expert's verdict mentions that in an interview with the Washington Post on 9 December 2015, Donald Trump stated that he "will never leave the race." This aspect verifies that the claim of him suspending his campaign is false.
Source credibility: The expert's verdict mentions that the website Q Political frequently publishes articles with misleading titles. While it is not specifically known as a satirical website, it is implied that it may not be a reliable source. This aspect questions the authenticity of the claim and suggests that the source may not be trustworthy.
